0: The patient is a 44 year old male with no significant past medical history who presents with possible foreign body in the esophagus.  Esophageal Ring, possible food inpaction:  The patient presented with a sensation that he had food stuck in his esophagus. Sensation occurred after aspirating a piece of chiken and was initially associated with difficulty managing his secretions. He was transferred from [**Hospital3 **] for gastroenterology evaluation.  He was admitted to the ICU and underwent upper endosocopy which revealed an esophageal ring and abnormal mucosa of the distal esophagus but no impacted food.  He was started on protonix for acid suppression.  He will follow up with gastroenterology in clinic for consideration of esophageal ring dilation.  Hypertension: Patient hypertensive on admission without documented history of hypertension.  Likely related to discomfort and anxiety. He should follow up with his primary care physician for ambulatory blood pressure monitoring.
